description.value:
The unicorn makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The unicorn touches another creature with its horn. The target magically regains [[/damage 2d8 + 2 type=heal average=false]] hit points. In addition, the touch removes all diseases and neutralizes all poisons afflicting the target.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The unicorn magically teleports itself and up to three willing creatures it can see within 5 feet of it, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, to a location the unicorn is familiar with, up to 1 mile away.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regional Effects

Transformed by the creature’s &Reference[celestial]{celestial} presence, the domain of a unicorn might include any of the following magical effects:

  • Open flames of a nonmagical &Reference[nat]{nature} are extinguished within the unicorn’s domain. Torches and campfires refuse to burn, but closed lanterns are unaffected.
  • Creatures native to the unicorn’s domain have an easier time hiding; they have advantage on all &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} (&Reference[ste]{Stealth}) checks made to hide.
  • When a good-aligned creature casts a spell or uses a magical effect that causes another good-aligned creature to regain hit points, the target regains the maximum number of hit points possible for the spell or effect.
  • Curses affecting any good-aligned creature are suppressed.

If the unicorn dies, these effects end immediately.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

A Unicorn’s Lair

A unicorn’s lair might be an ancient ruin overgrown with vines, a misty clearing surrounded by mighty oaks, a flower-covered hilltop alive with butterflies, or some other serene woodland location.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The unicorn can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The unicorn regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Hooves. The unicorn makes one attack with its hooves.

Shimmering Shield (Costs 2 Actions). The unicorn creates a shimmering, magical field around itself or another creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target gains a +2 bonus to AC until the end of the unicorn’s next turn.

Heal Self (Costs 3 Actions). The unicorn magically regains [[/damage 2d8 + 2 type=heal average=false]] hit points.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The unicorn creates a shimmering, magical field around itself or another creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target gains a +2 bonus to AC until the end of the unicorn’s next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The unicorn magically regains [[/damage 2d8 + 2 type=heal average=false]] hit points.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Charge. If the unicorn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra [[/damage 2d8 type=piercing average=true]] damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save str 15 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Innate Spellcasting. The unicorn’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 14). The unicorn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

At will: detect evil and good, druidcraft, pass without trace

1/day each: calm emotions, dispel evil and good, entangle

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. The unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Weapons. The unicorn’s weapon attacks are magical.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

For the duration, you know if there is an &Reference[aberration]{aberration}, &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, &Reference[fey]{fey}, &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or &Reference[undead]{undead} within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been magically consecrated or desecrated.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Whispering to the spirits of &Reference[nat]{nature}, you create one of the following effects within range:

  • You create a tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.
  • You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.
  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, a puff of wind, the sound of a small animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}.
  • You instantly light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) has a +10 bonus to &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} (&Reference[ste]{Stealth}) checks and can't be tracked except by magical means. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.

You attempt to suppress strong emotions in a group of people. Each &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} in a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on a point you choose within range must make a &Reference[cha]{Charisma} saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. If a creature fails its saving throw, choose one of the following two effects.

You can suppress any effect causing a target to be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} or &Reference[frightened]{frightened}. When this spell ends, any suppressed effect resumes, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.

Alternatively, you can make a target indifferent about creatures of your choice that it is hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the spell ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the DM rules otherwise.

Shimmering energy surrounds and protects you from &Reference[fey]{fey}, &Reference[undead]{undead}, and creatures originating from beyond the &Reference[material]{Material} Plane. For the duration, celestials, elementals, &Reference[fey]{fey}, fiends, and &Reference[undead]{undead} have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions.

Break &Reference[enc]{Enchantment}. As your action, you touch a creature you can reach that is &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, or possessed by a &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, an &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, a &Reference[fey]{fey}, a &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or an &Reference[undead]{undead}. The creature you touch is no longer &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, or possessed by such creatures.

Dismissal. As your action, make a melee spell attack against a &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, an &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, a &Reference[fey]{fey}, a &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or an &Reference[undead]{undead} you can reach. On a hit, you attempt to drive the creature back to its home plane. The creature must succeed on a &Reference[cha]{Charisma} saving throw or be sent back to its home plane (if it isn't there already). If they aren't on their home plane, &Reference[undead]{undead} are sent to the Shadowfell, and &Reference[fey]{fey} are sent to the Feywild.

Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw or be &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by the entangling plants until the spell ends. A creature &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by the plants can use its action to make a &Reference[str]{Strength} check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

When the spell ends, the conjured plants wilt away.

changes.value: You can take an action to break free by rolling a Strength Ability Check
turn=end, rollType=check, actionSave=true, saveAbility=str, saveDC=@attributes.spelldc, label=Restrained by Entangle
